sub_topic: Probability of a certain outcome in a sports game
message_1: In a soccer match, the probability of team A winning is 0.6 and the probability of team B winning is 0.3. What is the probability that the match ends in a draw?
message_2:
Since there are only three possible outcomes in a soccer match (team A wins, team B wins, or a draw), the probabilities of all outcomes must add up to 1. 

Let P(draw) be the probability of the match ending in a draw. 

P(team A wins) + P(team B wins) + P(draw) = 1

0.6 (team A winning) + 0.3 (team B winning) + P(draw) = 1

0.9 + P(draw) = 1

P(draw) = 1 - 0.9

P(draw) = 0.1

The probability that the match ends in a draw is 0.1 or 10%.
